name: Kummer–Vandiver conjecture
rephrased: For any prime number p, p does not divide the class number of the maximal real subfield of the p-th cyclotomic field.
implication_form: If p is a prime, then p does not divide the class number hK of the maximal real subfield of the p-th cyclotomic field.
explained: The Kummer-Vandiver conjecture is a statement in number theory that a prime \(p\) does not divide the class number of the maximal real subfield of the \(p\)-th cyclotomic field. It is equivalent to stating that \(p\) does not divide the second factor (\(h_{2}\)) of the class number of the \(p\)-th cyclotomic field. This conjecture has important implications, most notably that if it is true, Fermat's Last Theorem holds for the exponent \(p\).
